projects.name: Cubework US: Admin Console
description: Transformed API Fox documentation into functional components for seamless integration with frontend applications.
Designed UI/UX using Figma to create visually appealing and intuitive interfaces.
Discussing with US Business Analyst, Chinese Managers, and Project Managers about the functional requirements needed to make sure that it aligns with the timeline.
Implemented Frontend System Design to make sure the functional requirements aligns with the client needs while optimizing the overall system.
Implemented Payment Gateway for the Pay and Bill API, Customer Management for the CRM API, and Authorization of IAM API
Used Technologies: Figma, Tailwind, Vue, Vue Router, Typescript, Husky, Lint-staged, TanStack Vue Query, TanStack Vue Table, Pinia, Zod, TypeScript, Axios, Postman, ShadCN
Backend Technologies: Java Spring Boot, Spring Boot API Fox (Open API), .NET, .NET API Fox (Open API)

description: Transformed API Fox documentation into functional components for seamless integration with frontend applications.

Implemented Frontend System Design to make sure the functional requirements aligns with the client needs while optimizing the overall system.
Implemented Payment Gateway for the Pay and Bill API, Customer Management for the CRM API, and Authorization of IAM API

Used Technologies: Figma, Tailwind, React, Vue, Vue Router, Typescript, Husky, Lint-staged, TanStack Vue Query, TanStack Vue Table, Pinia, Zod, TypeScript, Redux, Axios, Postman, ShadCN, TanStack Query
Backend Technologies: Java Spring Boot, Spring Boot API Fox (Open API), .NET, .NET API Fox (Open API)

projects.name: IN BETWEEN: Agent System
description: Designed UI/UX using Figma to create visually appealing and intuitive interfaces.
Created a Prototype to propose a visually appealing and intuitive interfaces to the stakeholders.
Transformed Swagger API documentation into functional components for seamless integration with frontend applications.
Established the Web App based on the following: Overall Admin, Admin, Declarator, Guarantor, Master Agent, Sub-Agent, Player
Collaborated with backend developers to integrated real-time data using Signal R and other backend APIs

projects.name: CourseForge: Course Management System with hybrid recommender system
description: Freelance Undergraduate Thesis Project for S.Y. 2023-2024
Designed the UI/UX using Figma, resulting in a visually appealing and intuitive interface.
Built using React.js, TailwindCSS, MongoDB, and Django, ensuring a seamless user experience.
Designed a course management module that allows instructors to evaluate each studentâ€™s course.
Constructed an examination module that will be able to make exams provided by the instructors and that will be taken by the students.
Incorporated a recommendation module for students to learn the topics efficiently.
Other Technologies: Heroku, Git, WebStorm, Postman, PyCharm Professional, Google Colab, Jupyter Notebook

projects.name: Auto Axis: A Web Auto Repair Shop Management System and a Mobile Proximity Geolocation Services
description: Freelance Undergraduate Thesis Project for S.Y. 2023-2024
Designed the UI/UX using Figma, resulting in a visually appealing and intuitive interface.
Built using React.js, TailwindCSS, MongoDB, and Django, ensuring a seamless user experience.
Created a reservation module for the customers of Kloud Garage.
Integrated a vehicle maintenance record module.
Built an inventory module and a payroll module for the shop and its employees.
Integrated OpenStreetMap api to serve as the geolocator tool.
Created a pin locator for roadside/towing services and implement it using the dijkstra algorithm.
Other Technologies: Heroku, Git, WebStorm, Postman, PyCharm Professional, Google Colab, Jupyter Notebook

projects.name: Padayon's Tech: Online Ordering and Inventory Management System using Time Series and Analysis with ARIMA Model for Bagong Barrio Merchandise and Construction
description: Freelance Undergraduate Thesis Project for S.Y. 2023-2024
Designed the UI/UX using Figma, resulting in a visually appealing and intuitive interface.
Built using React.js, TailwindCSS, MongoDB, and Django, ensuring a seamless user experience.
Preprocessed data using Pandas and NumPy to improve time series analysis and forecasting accuracy.
Hypertuned the ARIMA model using scikit-learn to optimize forecasting results.
Created recommendation systems and notifications for predicting the in-demand stocks this month.
Streamlined the ordering and inventory management process, making it more efficient for users.
Created a pin locator for roadside/towing services and implement it using the dijkstra algorithm.
Other Technologies: Heroku, Git, WebStorm, Postman, PyCharm Professional, Google Colab, Jupyter Notebook

projects.name: MDCC Intranet: Employees e-learning platform with CMS
description: Developed MDCC Intranet, an employees e-learning platform with CMS.
Designed the UI/UX using Figma, resulting in a visually appealing and user-friendly interface.
Utilized TailwindCSS and jQuery to ensure a seamless user experience.
Implemented a content management system (CMS) for easy management and updating of platform content.
Added it to AWS and Azure using Python, ensuring easy access and scalability.

projects.name: JETA: The Nutritional meal ordering and Delivery App with Web-based Admin Management
description: Freelance Undergraduate Thesis Project for S.Y. 2022-2023
Designed the UI/UX of the mobile and website using Figma, resulting in a visually appealing and intuitive interface.
Built using React.js, TailwindCSS, Django, Kotlin, and MongoDB to ensure a seamless user experience.
Other Technologies: Heroku, Git, WebStorm, Postman, Android Studio, Intellij IDEA Ultimate

projects.name: iClick: A Mobile and Web-based application for barangay Camp Aguinaldo using Apriori Algorithm
description: Freelance Undergraduate Thesis Project for S.Y. 2021-2022
Designed the UI/UX of the mobile and website using Figma, resulting in a visually appealing and intuitive interface.
Implemented the Apriori Algorithm to suggest relevant announcements and services to users.
Utilized React.js, TailwindCSS, Django, Kotlin, and MongoDB to provide a seamless user experience.
Other Technologies:  Heroku, Git, WebStorm, Postman, Android Studio, Intellij IDEA Ultimate

projects.name: Naive Bees: Image Loading and Processing
description: Load, transform, and understand (ETL) images of honey bees and bumble bees in Python.

projects.name: The Hottest  Topics in Machine Learning
description: Used Natural Language Processing on NIPS papers to uncover the trendiest topics in machine learning research.

projects.name: Naive Bees: Species from Images
description: Built a model that can automatically detect and bumble bess in images.

projects.name: Classify Song Genres from Audio Data
description: Rock or rap? Applied machine learning  methods in Python to classify songs into genres.

projects.name: Predict Taxi Fares with Random Forests
description: Used regression trees and random forests to find places where New York taxi drivers earn the most.

projects.name: ASL Recognition with Deep Learning
description: Built a convolutional neural network to classify images of letters from American Sign Language.

projects.name: Clustering Heart Disease Patient Data
description: Experimented with clustering algorithms to help doctors inform treatment for heart disease patients.

projects.name: Naive Bees: Deep Learning with Images
description: Built a deep learning model that can automatically detect honey bees and bumble bees in images.

projects.name: Predicting Credit Card Approvals
description: Built a machine learning model that can predict if a credit card application will get approved.

projects.name: Degrees that Pay you back
description: Explored the salary potential of college majors with a k-means cluster analysis.

projects.name: Planning Public Policy in Argentina
description: Applied unsupervised learning techniques to help plan an education program in Argentina

projects.name: Clustering Bustabit Gambling Behavior
description: Used clustering analysis to glen insights into cryptocurrency gambling behavior.

projects.name: Give Life: Predict Blood Donations
description: Built a binary classifier to predict if a blood donor is likely to donate again.

projects.name: Find Movie Similarity from Plot Summaries
description: Used NLP and clustering on movie plot summaries from IMDb and Wikipedia to quantify movie similarity.

projects.name: Comparing Cosmetics by Ingredients
description: Processed Ingredient lists for cosmetics on Sephora then visualize similarity using t-SNE and Bokeh.

projects.name: The Impact of Climate  Change on Birds
description: Predicted the impact of climate change on bird distributions using spatial data and machine learning.

projects.name: What Makes a Pokemon Legendary?
description: Used tree-based machine learning methods to identify the characteristics of legendary Pokemon.

projects.name: Predictive Modeling for Agriculture
description: Took a hands-on learning into the fascinating world of agriculture with this use case! Discovered how multi-class machine learning is being utilized to assist farmers in cultivating the perfect crop each season. Through hands-on experiences with actual scenarios, I have learned the art of applying supervised ML and feature selection techniques to solve real-world problems.

projects.name: Predicting Move Rental Durations
description: Helped a DVD rental company improved their inventory planning by building a regression model to predict customers DVD rental duration. Assess different regression models to recommend the most effective one to the company.

projects.name: Interpreting Unsupervised Learning Models
description: Arctic Penguin Exploration: Unraveled Clusters in the Icy Domain with K-means Clustering.

projects.name: Planning a Trip to Paris with the OpenAI API
description: Use OpenAI's powerful API to answer questions about tourist attractions in Paris.

projects.name: Reducing Traffic Mortality in the USA
description: How can we find a good strategy for reducing traffic-related deaths?

projects.name: Modeling Car Insurance Claim Outcomes
description: Cleaned customer data and used logictic regression to predict whether people will make a claim on their car insurance!

projects.name: Predicting Temperature in London
description: Perform a machine learning experiment to find the best modal that predicts the temperature in London!

projects.name: Cinema REST Room Manager
description: In this project, We created a simple Spring REST service that helped to manage a small movie theater. It handles HTTP requests in controllers, create services, and respond with JSON objects.

projects.name: Readability Score
description: You will understand the process of developing such a complex program as a game and learn about processing user input and handling errors.

projects.name: Battleship
description: You will understand the process of developing such a complex program as a game and learn about processing user input and handling errors.

projects.name: Traffic Light
description: By the end of this project, in addition to creating your own 'traffic light', you will learn how to work with multi-threading, handle exceptions, inherit classes, and implement and apply the circular queue data structure

projects.name: Rock-Paper-Scissors
description: A playable Rock-Paper-Scissors game, with a Player vs. Computer mode. Practice using arrays, the Random class, formatted strings, and algorithms.

projects.name: Bulls and Cows
description: Learn how to use integer arithmetic, generate random numbers, store data in data structures, and handle errors

projects.name: Chuck Norris Cipher En coder
description: This project will allow us to deal with string and character variables and work with loops and conditional statements. Get familiar with the binary notation and data type conversion. Create an application for the unary representation and decoding of any text.

projects.name: Coffee Machine
description: This project allows to better understand the basic OOP, its main concepts such as classes, class methods and attributes, and get a taste of Java. Practice working with methods, challenge yourself with loops and conditions, and get more confident with OOP.

projects.name: Amazing Numbers
description: The project covers basic operations on integers, as well as with collections. Make a program that indicates the properties of the numbers taken from the input

projects.name: Simple Tic-Tac-Toe
description: After finishing this project, We getting to know a lot about planning and developing a complex program from scratch, using methods, nested lists, list comprehension, handling errors, and processing user input.

projects.name: Cinema Room Manager
description: This project is a good opportunity to work with input and output in Java. You will deal with arrays and functions as well as loops and conditional statements.

projects.name: Zookeeper
description: It helps you understand some syntax basics and learn how to work with variables, data storage types such as arrays, and while loops.

projects.name: Simple Chatty Bot
description: Getting to know the basic syntax of Java and write a simple program using variables, conditions, loops, and methods.

projects.name: HyperSchool
description: Created models and forms. Also, developed a page templates and understand how to store and represent data with Django.

projects.name: HyperNews Portal
description: I learn the basics of creating web applications with the Django framework: handle data through HTTP and work with HTML templates. The project also work with json files and python DataTime type, as well as design using vanilla CSS.

projects.name: HyperJob Agency
description: Created a dynamic website with Django.

projects.name: HyperForms
description: I set up a simple Django project. Handle requests and made templates for the web pages. Also, It has how to save and retrieve data from a database
